title: Highlight of my year

text: From the incredibly beautiful villas themselves to the amazing staff and food, Saba Villas is a class act and one of the best places I've ever stayed. I loved the location, close to both Seminyak and the main hub of Canggu, while only a few minutes stroll from the beach. Hot Tip: Ask Made the chef to make you one of his famous mohitos!
title: Canggu Haven

text:
My favourite holiday! I stayed for a week with a group of friends in three of the connecting Villas. The service was incredible; the staff were so lovely and helpful. We loved the extras that Saba offers - There is nothing more relaxing and enjoyable than having a massage or manicure in your own outdoor lounge area by the pool!

Perfect location. Although we found it hard to leave the Villas, Canggu has great shopping, nightlife, cafes and restaurants without the chaos of Seminyak. 

Overall it was a fantastic experience. I wouldn't travel to Bali and stay anywhere else.
title: Beautiful Villas! A Truly Luxurious Experience

text: An unforgettable weekend! I booked 4 of the 5 interconnecting villas for my 30th birthday. My friends were delighted to find each villa had a private pool. The amazing team at Saba pulled out all the stops as usual. I live in Jakarta and these villas are truly my 'happy place'. This time I was particularly impressed by the chefs who catered to 14 of us ordering different meals and brought all the dishes out on time, together, for breakfast everyday and kept up with our complex and changeable lunch orders too, somehow managing to remember who everyone was and what couple they were in or not etc. But the real highlight was my dinner - after Made the chef helped me work out a menu and after strolling back from beach sunset cocktails at nearby la Laguna on the beach, we returned to find the staff had decked out Yudhistira villa with flowers, lanterns in trees, torches and hand made seat decorations and we ate in the garden on a table covered in flowers. The staff made margaritas and mojitos to start with a range of canapés followed by an incredible suckling pig with wine from the cellar and panna cotta with pistachios and raspberries... To top it off they let off some serious fireworks ... Hey if you can't let off fireworks on your 30th, when can you do it?!? If you are looking to relax, eat good food, be close to seminyak's restos and canggu's laid back surfer culture, look no further! I give this place my highest recommendation! They also know how to throw a party!
title: 30th birthday celebrations with 14 friends

photos.caption: An incredible birthday feast complete with suckling pig, fireworks and private poolside dining
An incredible birthday feast complete with suckling pig, fireworks and private poolside dining
An incredible birthday feast complete with suckling pig, fireworks and private poolside dining
An incredible birthday feast complete with suckling pig, fireworks and private poolside dining

text:
The Saba property cannot be faulted.  A gorgeous pool with each villa; friendly staff; beautiful lounge overlooking the pool; kitchen with plenty of space; and spectacular indoor/outdoor bathrooms.  The property really is lovely and relaxing.  The food options prepared by staff were also to a very high standard and reasonably priced.  
The location - not so great.  The villas are about a 10-15 minute walk to the beach.  There are a few shops and restaurants nearby BUT you need to face what we called the 'walk of death' - a busy road, full of cars, motorbikes and traffic, with no footpath to speak of.  It really was quite horrendous and not conducive to relaxation.  The Canggu Club facilities are a short taxi-ride away and not too bad especially for the kiddies.  Canggu is a little away from Seminyak which is where the heart of the action seems to be.  So if you wanted to be able to walk out of Saba and have your pick of boutiques, restaurants and bars, you may be a little disappointed.  Despite that we had a lovely time and thought it was a special little property - an oasis in the midst of the Bali bustle.
title: Lovely villa; location not so great

text:
Our third visit to Saba - and the fact we keep coming back says it all. The villas are roomy and have everything you need. The pool is huge and outdoor bathroom very cool.
Our room also included a Nespresso machine.
But it's the little touches which set Saba apart - they always put out plenty of mosquito coils, for example. 
Nothing is too much trouble for the staff who are very attentive - especially Dewik (who has looked after us so well on every visit) and Made. 
They took extra care of our five month old son, including providing a cot, mosquito net and brand new blanket. 
The free entry to the Canggu International Club is a real value add. The day spa was excellent and the water park for kids (and big kids) terrific. For families, this is a huge saving because it's around $A30 per adult and $A18 per child for entry without the membership provided by Saba.
The new shops at the top of the driveway are also great - we had too many chocolate eclairs from the French patisserie.
One slight annoyance is a requirement to order your lunch or dinner two hours in advance. That means it's fresh, but it also means you have to plan ahead. My wife particularly loved the pork cutlet.  
All up, a great, relaxing holiday. We look forward to visit number four.
title: Sensational Saba - you've done it again

text:
This was a long awaited holiday.  Sometimes that makes it hard for a location to live up to long drawn out expectations but Saba Villas not only met, but exceeded them.  Right from the moment we were greeted at the airport the staff were friendly and gracious.  Nothing was too much trouble.  

We stayed in Yudhistira which was well laid out to catch the breeze and provide enough shade in the later afternoon for a cool swim.  

Located close to Seminyak the Villa is near some great facilities and restaurants.  At the end of the street is a great French bakery, a yoghurt shop that does amazing green juices, and a chocolate shop.  The Villa provides you with access to the Canguu Club which provided lots of entertainment for our kids.  

It was a great trip and we will definitely be back.
title: Exactly what we needed

text:
It is hard to fault this place.

We went to relax and spend time as a family. We managed this very quickly. The villa is well appointed, had plenty of space, excellent breakfast and was very peaceful.

The staff did their job very well. Nothing was too much trouble and they are friendly. The staff are attentive without being annoying.

My kids particularly enjoyed taking advantage of the Canggu club water park, kids club and Bounce (things badly unique to Bali but they are 7 and 4).

Saba Villa comes with a strong recommendation from myself and my family. We will return.
title: Excellent facilities and service

text: Tee villas are very well-located, close enough to Seminyak but far enough for a peaceful stay. The villas are very well appointed and clean. The outdoor bathrooms are great. The staff were so obliiging and friendly. A truly relaxing experience.
title: Saba Villas - a great place to relax

owner_response.text: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback about Saba Villas. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Look forward to having you back again.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We recently stayed in the Nakula Villa for five nights with our five month old daughter. The staff were extremely friendly & accommodating. They met all our needs + more (they had a babyseat in the car for us, a cot ready, and had arranged a trusted babysitter to help out). 

The villa was absolutely beautiful- two bedrooms, each with an indoor/outdoor ensuite (nothing quite says paradise like taking your daily shower in the open air), a private swimming pool, living room and kitchen (great to prepare baby food). The days were spent reading & enjoying the sunshine. 

The location is also excellent. It is far away from the hustle & bustle of Seminyak, but close enough to enjoy all that Seminyak has to offer. 

I have to give a shout-out to the food at Saba. The menu is quite extensive, with Indonesian and Western favourites. Saba has a food hygiene certificate (so you know that you won't get the dreaded Bali belly). I am vegetarian, and the chef would adjust some recipes to suit my dietary requirements. I can highly recommend the corn fritters, the stuffed tofu and the Balinese salad. 

Do you want a relaxing, peaceful holiday? Look no further than Saba.
title: Peaceful & Relaxing

photos.caption: The only photo we have without us in it! The beautiful Nakula pool

text:
Saba is a wonderful choice for any trip to Bali. It has everything - private and tranquil villas; a great location close to Seminak and several beaches but away from the bustle; great food and amazing service. I can't recommend this place highly enough.

We spent four nights at Saba and loved every minute. Our days quickly settled into a peaceful rhythm: mornings relaxing by our private pool, afternoons exploring the local area, sunset by the beach and dinner either at Saba or one of the many great restaurants close by. Saba will drop guests in town or at the beach, and can also organise a private driver for any trips slightly further afield. We certainly appreciated their tips for dinner spots as well!

The Saba staff, and in particular their chef, were fabulous. No request was too much trouble, but they also went out of their way not to disturb us when we were relaxing in our villa. A particular highlight was the fantastic private seafood BBQ they organised for us one evening, which they cooked in our villa gardens and served at a table set up by our pool. The food was brilliant and the experience even more so.

All the villas are different, but from what we saw you really can't go wrong with any of them. All have a private pool, well-designed layout and are more than comfortable. We stayed in 'Arjuna' (the smallest villa with one-bedroom), which was a great choice for a couple.

Saba is simply amazing. We will be back!
title: Chill out in Canggu

text:
The two roomed villa was simply beautiful. Light, spacious and airy with lovely touches like outdoor bathrooms, comfortable sun loungers and plenty of shaded space in the lounge area. The staff had the perfect balance of being attentive but never imposing.  

Delicious breakfasts, heavenly massages ... the villa had everything. I highly recommend staying here.
title: Luxury villa with attentive staff, a wonderful long weekend

text: This is a beautiful, beautiful property and made for one of our best holidays - the kids loved the pool and Villa Bima is beautiful laid out with all the amenities a family could need during a holiday. In addition the staff went above and beyond to meet every single request we put forward, including organizing a birthday party for my older child. Special call out to Dewi and Bagus who helped worked out our itinerary including restaurant reservations...no request was so small or too difficult. We will definitely return!
title: Magical!

text:
I was speechless upon walking into the Sadewa villa. The enormous, open living room, beautifully finished with dark timbers, looked out onto an immaculate pool, bale and garden. It was utterly tranquil, despite being a stones throw from the heart of bustling Canggu. My partner and I felt alone in our own private, boutique paradise. I'd hoped for something special for her 30th birthday, but this villa was beyond anything I'd imagined. 
The attention of Bagus and his team was flawless, the service top notch. They made you feel truly at home while you lazed about the villa, leaving you to your own devices, but were immediately on hand if anything was needed. Not that there was much more needed - the villa had everything from WiFi to surround sound, movies on demand, cold drinks in the fridge and an incredible room service menu.
The four-course degustation arranged by the chef on our first night was outstanding, with a lantern-lit table in the garden and private waiters creating a very special evening indeed. We actually ate in the villa for two of our three nights, as the food was so exceptional and the ambience unbeatable.
This is a destination for those seeking something truly different from Bali and the rash of villas available. This is more than simply a cut above the rest. It's five-star perfection!
Cannot wait to go back.
title: Private paradise in the heart of Canggu

text:
Best villa in Bali! This villa is amazing - open plan lounge and dining, with private pools and lush gardens. We were constantly in awe of the beauty of our surrounds, and it was incredibly relaxing. 

What sets this villa apart is the staff. They are some of the best hospitality staff I've encountered anywhere in the world. Incredibly discreet, you will not realise they are even there, but you'll notice due to the touches around the villa (e.g. beds turned down, table set up, etc). But if you need them, they are there in an instant and ready to help. The driver is also very knowledgable and can safely take you anywhere in the area. The villa staff can help you with anything you would like to do in the area e.g. cooking classes, visiting markets, massage/beauty to your villa, restaurant bookings, etc. 

It's a real plus to have access to the Canggu Club. I could understand why you wouldn't want to leave Saba, but venturing to the club is well worth it for a swim, workout and lunch. 

Highly recommend Saba. There are many fine accommodation choices in Canggu/Seminyak, but Saba is on another level with the caring staff.
title: Best villa in Bali

text: What an excellent villa. In four groups of 2 bedrooms with all other facilities, our group was enough to occupy several, open the large garden doors and the multiple pools come into play.  So for a couple, or for a group, all are covered.The service was relaxed but efficient and the meals including a special BBQ excellent.
title: A weekend in Bali !

text:
We spent our 30th wedding anniversary with our family in Saba Bali and it will be a celebration that none of us will forget. 
The ambience was one of peace and serenity,the villas encapsulated tropical luxury and the staff gave us the gift of their smiles along with their total commitment to making our stay the best it could be. 
Saba is not about what your money can buy you--- it's more about having found a special place where everything comes together to create a harmony of  beauty,tranquility and service.  Add inspired architecture,a wonderful garden and excellent food into the mix and you really do have it all. 
Here is somewhere to be indulged and spoiled,whilst still retaining a sense of the spiritual in the surroundings. It is unique in so many ways. 
Our celebration was the most amazing opportunity for our kids to create a special evening for us and for us to enjoy each other and our family --- but it was all made possible by the eagerness of the staff to provide us with a special night, as well as the extraordinary cooperation and suggestions of the owner, which resulted in a Balinese dance troup,a fabulous feast complete with suckling pig and champagne,followed by a band and great music for us to dance to late into the night. And what a night it was!  I shall never forget. 
We'll be back---- but I think that is fairly obvious.
title: A secret haven within a tropical paradise.

text: As Bali booms it is harder and harder to find a place that has that special blend of beaches, peace, food and comfort. The villas were a stylish oasis where we time stood still. The staff are stellar, and their service is the right balance of privacy and attention. As a well travelled expat in Indonesia - the food is up there with the best. Get out of Seminyak - and get into Saba! We will definitely be back.
title: Stunning Oasis

text:
We have just had 5 very relaxing and peaceful nights at Saba. The staff and service are always exceptional and make the stay there that much better. This is the 3rd time I have stayed at Saba villas and already looking forward to my next visit!
Although you are not staying in the heart of Seminyak, Saba is less than a $4 cab fare to Seminyak Square and being in Canggu means you are away from the noise of traffic and busyness of Seminyak.
So if you would like a really relaxing luxury 5 star private villa experience in Bali I would strongly recommend staying at Saba.

Thank you very much Bagus and the team at Saba for another wonderful holiday in Bali!
title: Always the best holiday in Bali at Saba!

text:
I traveled as part of a large group and we hired four of the five available villas, and so I got to sample both the one-bed and two-bed villas.
All of the villas are amazing. I stayed in the 'smaller' style two bedroom apartment, which was vast and with a good sized pool. The larger style two bed villas are palatial. All are tastefully decorated in a contemporary Balinese style, and feature large out-door bathrooms with excellent amenities.
All apartments have free wi-fi and access to an exhaustive collection of films.
If the rooms were a delicious cake then the staff would have to be the icing! From the moment we arrived the staff were gracious and attentive, tending to our needs quietly and efficiently.  I have not received such a high level of service ever before.
We ate in the villas frequently and the food is good.
One minor gripe is the location, which is a little too remote to make walking to beach/ bars/ restaurants feasible. Travel by villa car or taxi is cheap however, and in any case the villas are so lovely you may not want to leave.
title: Exquisite

text:
This place is pure luxury! Everything about it was amazing. 
By far the highlight of Saba is the staff. They are the most accommodating bunch of people I have ever come across and nothing was ever too difficult for them to arrange. Service with a smile every time but they were never in our way. I can't speak highly enough of the staff, they were truly amazing. 
We recently visited as a large group and rented four out of the five villas. We stayed in Nakula, the smallest of the two bedroom villas but still with plenty of space. We were a group of 13 adults and we were all able to hang out in one villa and not be crowded which was a huge bonus. 
The villas were all nicely fitted out, the highlight for me would be the outdoor bathroom that was huge! The kitchens were all fitted out with lots of glassware and a huge tub of ice in the freezer, both essential with large groups. The grounds were also kept in immaculate condition and you feel like you have entered your own private sanctuary once you reach the driveway. 
The food at the villa was also excellent. The room service menu had an extensive selection and was all very reasonably priced, much cheaper than larger hotels. The drinks in the mini bar were also reasonably priced and well stocked. 
I have been to Bali three times and have always stayed in villas and Saba would definitely be my top pick. I can't wait to come back again.
title: Pure Perfection

text: We love SABA. It is perfectly located between Canggu and Seminyak allowing you easy access to the fun restaurants and shopping at Seminyak and  the various surf breaks at Canggu, plus the more laid back style cafes and shops just to the north of the villas. Bungalow was our daily spot for morning coffee. We rented motor cycles (organised by the staff) which gave us great flexibility in zooming around but Made or Bagus were always on hand to drop us somewhere in the Villa car, which was particularly useful at night.  You can walk to a really cool yoga school just up the road called Desa Seni, and there is a small surf shop across the road where you can rent boards for a week or two at around R70,000 per day. The relatively new French bakery at the end of the drive makes great bread, croissants and pretty good coffee........not that you need extra food. Breakfast is included in the room rate and the quality is excellent. On top of that there is 24 hour food and drink service, all of a very high quality, anything from a great burger to a brilliant mi goreng......... and they know how to make great cocktails. Having lived in Jakarta for 8 years in the late 80's/early 90's we have spent a lot of time in Bali and have stayed at numerous hotels and villas. SABA is right up there. It is owned by 2 Australians who have also spent a lot of time in Indonesia and Asia. They have instilled very high professional standards in their staff who are always outstanding in every respect. Their English is also very good. We stayed in Yudhistira, one of the larger 2 bed room villas, the other one being Bima. There are only 5 villas in total so it is very personal yet has the same standard of service as a boutique hotel. Will be back for sure.
title: Our second visit but will not be our last !

text: I have lost count of the number of times I have stayed at Saba. One of the best things about this villa is its location - in the mornings I choose between a 10 minute walk to the surf break at berawa beach or an even shorter walk in the opposite direction to Yoga at Desa Seni art village. In the evenings it's a 5 minute cab ride to the now bustling batu belig strip with its many cafes, bars and shops and another 5 minutes to Seminyak. The tapas place on the corner, La Finca, is fabulous too.  Depending on what villa you're in you can walk there through the rice paddies out the back. Most of the time though it's hard to drag me out of the villa - Saba has a Food Safety accreditation which means all the food is washed in purified water (unlike many other places in Indonesia) and handled according to international standards. I love knowing that whenever I eat the food there it will be delicious (just ask Chef Made to make 'something special' for you and he will blow you away!) and won't give me bali belly.
title: Amazing location and food safety accredited

text:
Amazing staff, great all round service, very well appointed villa and good location only 10min away from Seminyak.  We will just keep coming back.

We stayed in Villa Bima with two toddlers.  The staff were very accommodating to our children and always stopped for a chat or joke around with them - was great.  The catering was also excellent and able to accommodate requests for baby purees and kids food.  

We had a great time and without a doubt will be back, I'm not sure we could have wished for more from a villa holiday!
title: First rate - we will be back

text: Our stay at Saba was just superb! The rooms are beautiful and clean and the staff so friendly and helpful - nothing is too much to ask for. Food at Saba is delicious. The beach is not far and famous Echo beach only 10 minutes away on a scooter. We will be back!
title: Saba villas! Excellent!

text:
these villas are well appointed and the staff are fantastic and friendly and eager to please (without being in your face.)
The food is very good with a broad selection.a great example of why villas are often better than a hotel....
The 2 bedroom villas are as good as they look on the net.
title: Refreshingly Good

text: My friend and me stayed at Saba for two nights and we were blown away by this place. It starts with the location, which is off the main tourist areas and it is not far to the sea. The place itself is just amazing, with lots of space, very beautiful rooms, an outdoor bathroom, a very big pool and nice common area. One immediatly starts too relax once you steps into Saba. The hole place is very luxury and every detail is thought of. But what makes Saba villas exceptionell is definitly the staff! The are just awesome and so friendly. There is always a smile on their faces and they make you feel at home the moment you arrive.
title: The place to be on Bali

photos.caption: Pool with the room in the background
Name of one of the Rooms

text:
The most special thing about Saba and what sets it apart from other villas in Bali is the staff. 
I stayed with Saba for 5 nights in Villa Arjuna and every moment was perfect. 

Down to the finest detail everything here has been considered.  I spent most of my time inside laying by the beautiful pool and relaxing. If, like me, you are beat from travelling around Bali - then this is the utopia you seek. Firstly, the villa is completely private. If I hadn't bumped into the family staying next door one day at lunch, I wouldn't have even known they were there! And my villa was so tranquil with almost no sound apart from some light trickle from the fountains -  A beautiful setting which was the calmest place I have meditated in all of Bali! 
I love love loved choosing from the selection of movies, tv series and documentaries offered here. They have a huge variety with something to suit everyone. Whoever made the list has great taste! Another favourite - the free Ipod dock!
The gardens are beautiful and the grass is so green and soft I didn't even use the sun beds once!
The food is amazing - try the Eggs Benedict with smoked salmon. I was hooked. 

The villas are centrally located and there are a few good places to eat just a couple of minutes walk away but the chefs here are unbeatable. 
I went to the nearby Canggu Club for my yoga which was very impressive and it was a lovely touch to have membership here included in my stay. 
As mentioned, what that really made Saba special for me were the people. All the staff were so very warm and I really did feel as though this was my home in Bali. I was by myself in the villa and seeing their friendly faces every day and having a chat really sets this place apart. 

Thank you to Bagus and his staff. Keep up the amazing work!
title: Special & Spoilt

text: We recently enjoyed a short stay at Saba and fell in love with the place and its amazing staff. The complex is small with only five villas so we were treated like royalty. Canggu is now our favourite area and we rarely venture into the crowds and traffic of Seminyak. So many great restaurants and bars have opened up in recent years within 5 minutes of Saba. Having said that, we ended up eating most of our meals in Saba because of Chef Made, usually leaving it up to Chef to concoct his amazing dishes. The staff will happily set up a candle-lit dinner by the pool and then we just linger over a three course dinner with great wines from the owner's private cellar. The villas themselves are huge and beautifully decorated and maintained. The complex is set about 100 m off the main road so it is very peaceful and private. Each villa has its own garden and pool with complete privacy. We stayed in a two-bedroom master villa and the small extra cost was well worth it. The master villas are very spacious and include an air-conditioned kitchen-dining room which can seat up to 10 for a dinner party. Finally, I have to say that the open-air bathroom was just brilliant. The attention to detail throughout the whole complex is amazing and the gardens beautifully maintained. Can't wait to get back later this year for a long stay. Thank you Saba and your wonderful staff!
title: The perfect combination of luxury and exclusivity

text:
It's rare to find a place in which all the various elements needed for that perfect holiday - atmosphere, ambience, staff, food, facilities, services, location, aesthetics - come together seamlessly. Saba delivered.

We stayed at Saba for several nights in spring and had access to both the largest villa and a more modest villa. On first arriving at Saba you can immediately see that a personal touch and creative intelligence has gone into everything - from the signature antique-style wooden doors to the bedroom of even the more modest villa, to the tasteful sculptures and flowing indoor/outdoor natural-style bathroom of the largest villa. The gardens of the villas have been painstakingly designed, with staghorns and ferns deliberately grafted to larger trees, in a relaxing fusion of man-made and natural aesthics.

The facilities, staff and services were amazing. We arrived in Bali late one night and were met by a friendly driver. We were famished and so after we checked in we asked the kitchen to prepare a late night burger, which was delicious. An extensive menu and wine list notwithstanding, a couple times we simply asked the chef to surprise us and prepare a Balinese three course meal, which tasted excellent and were surprisingly inexpensive. The villa is a peaceful bike ride or short cab trip to the centre of Seminyak or the Canggu Club (the latter which the villa gave me a membership to access, at no cost). The staff are all uniformly and genuinely friendly, to the extent that one morning we asked the chef to give us a cooking lesson and he also took us to the local markets to buy the necessary fresh produce - definitely off the beaten tourist track!

I had a fantastic time at Saba and would certainly recommend it.
title: Perfection in paradise

text: I stayed for four nights in Saba and had an absolutely amazing experience. My partner and I stayed in one of the most suite and we were blown away by the size and luxury of the villa. The pool and living areas were huge and meant we had little desire to venture out into bali. Lying by the pool was much more enticing! The food (both Indonesian and Western) was also great. We had some of our best (and cheapest) meals at the villas. The staff were all uniformly lovely and helpful and I can't wait to stay in Saba again!
title: Amazing stay at Saba

text: I have stayed at Saba three times now and I would not stay anywhere else.  The villas are exquisite and luxurious.  They are extremely roomy, beautifully presented and equipped with absolutely everything you need.  The pool and garden areas are even better than as portrayed in pictures. The staff at Saba are also incredible.  They are attentive, helpful and make the stay very easy.  The food is divine.  The chef at Saba made us a personal three course dinner - after giving the chef some indication of what we liked and did not like, we were presented with a four course "surprise" banquet and were blown away!   I highly recommend staying at Saba. It is worth every penny.
title: Exquisite and luxurious

text: We stayed for four nights at Saba Villas and it was blissful to enjoy the beautiful grounds and spacious villa. The layout and design are luxurious, and the quality of the food and cocktails was very high. The outdoor bathroom was delightful, and we enjoyed spending the days lounging around the pool. This location is quieter and a little more isolated than staying in Seminyak, but it is possible to walk places or hire a taxi for a short drive to nearby restaurants. Last but by no means least, the staff were very friendly, always helpful and provided excellent service.
title: A quiet oasis

text: I stayed at Saba a year ago and couldn't wait to get back. The Canggu area has really developed but Saba is still as private and peaceful as before. The villas are meticulously maintained and the garden and pool area is superb. I stayed in one of the master villas, Bima, which has a huge garden and lots of living area. We spent most of our time lounging around in the open living room next to the pool. Again, the dining was fantastic and Saba still has Chef Made putting together his innovative and beautifully presented meals. We rarely ventured out but there are many new restaurants within 5 minutes drive of Saba and there's really no need to head into the crowds and traffic in Semanyak. And I have to again thank the warm and caring staff who make you feel so welcome. We'll be back again next year, hopefully for a longer stay.
title: My second stay was better than the first...brilliant!

text:
This was exactly what we were looking for.  A beautiful villa with excellent staff and great food in a warm environ. 

From the moment we were met at the airport until our sad farewell we were thoroughly spoilt. The team at Saba go out of their way to look after you from organizing activities, driving you into town and catering for your every whim in a very friendly manner.

This was a wonderfully relaxing and comfortable holiday. Thank you to all involved with Saba for making it this. We will be back.
title: Perfect

text:
We recently returned from an 8 night stay at Saba Villas and loved every minute. We stayed in both Arjuna (a one bedroom villa) and Nakula (a two bedroom villa) and both villas were perfect!
Saba is located in a Canggu, just a short drive to Seminyak. Canggu is relatively less developed than some of the other nearby beach areas (notwithstanding lots of building and construction being in progress) which meant that it was very relaxing and within the walls of the villas very quiet and private. Having said that there is a free car service to the Seminyak area a couple of times a day (and it is only a $5 taxi ride in any case) so when you need to get out and about it is easy.
Both villas were wonderful. Both had plenty of room, were very clean, had great pools and were very private. Breakfast each day was included, cooked fresh and was very good. The only thing that could be improved (and isn't a huge deal) is that some of the linen was starting to look a little old and tired and is probably due for replacing. Whilst we didn't need to, some of the garden walls open up to enable the villas to be "joined" which is a very good feature for bigger groups.
The staff at the villas were amazing and made us feel very welcome. They were more than happy to organise anything for us from dinner bookings, in room massages, golf trips, transportation or facilitate any special requests. It was also nice to return home each day and be welcomed warmly with a big smile.
Overall a terrific property and next time we are in Bali we will definitely be back!
title: Wonderful stay!

text: Have just returned from 7days staying at Saba Villas in Canggu, We stayed with friends in Bima Villa. (A large 2 bedroom Villa).  We do lots of holiday trips to destinations all over the world. This place ranks up there with the best. We could be completely private or join the throng. The staff were fantastic, helpful, and organised our every request. Nothing was to much trouble. We were 15 minutes from Echo Beach, 5 minutes from five star restaurants and 10 minutes from shopping in Saminak.  While we had our own private pool we also had free access to the private members only Canggu Club just 4 minutes away where there was a bigger pool, Gym, playing fields and a whole lot more. I would recommend this place to anyone.
title: Saba Villas

text:
I travelled many times to Bali and stayed in many villas.  Saba is the best place I've stayed.  I filled out their questionnaire at the end of the trip and I gave them 10 out of 10 for everything.  I have never given 10 out of 10 anywhere I've stayed.  The villa was perfect, the staff were so lovely and helpful.  The chefs...wow can't they cook and the breakfasts,  we would order everything cause we didn't want to miss out!
Highly recommend this to anyone going to Bali
From
Jen, Deb Gayle and Maruis
title: Saba. Villas

text:
We loved Saba. My friend and I booked Saba last minute (and got a small discount) and were amazed. We came from Dusun villa and we liked Saba a bit more just because it felt more modern and our speed. The pool was GREAT - always warm - even late at night and the staff was fantastic.

In general, i would highly recommend Saba for anyone visiting Bali but just know a few things:

1) It's fairly pricey compared to other options like Dusun
2) It's a bit out of the way - we wanted to get food on a weekday at 10PM and it was VERY difficult to find something - everything was either closed or very far away...we ordered in which was decent but it would have been nice to be able to have other options
3) in general, there isn't much nightlife here - it's not really in seminyak...its closer to canggu beach which is a decent bike ride away. 
4) the free membership/access to the canggu beach club with tennis and weightroom was awesome!!

Overall, this is a terrific spot and great for any couples, families or honeymooners. It's not bad for groups of friends but i think there are are better-located places for groups of friends.
title: Amazing place but a bit out of the way

text: We have just returned from beautiful Saba bali, and are already planning our next visit! We travelled there with our two boys aged 1 and 3, and from the moment we set foot into the villa we were in paradise. The villa's are absolutely magnificent- the best we've seen- and the staff treated us like royalty- from installing a pool fence to arranging in-villa massages and trustworthy babysitters- nothing was too much trouble. The staff were so friendly and just loved the kids, which made our stay even more enjoyable. The breakfasts were amazing, and the chef's bali curry was the best we've had. Next time we plan to make the most of a personal cooking class so we can make it at home. The villa was only a short taxi ride to Seminyak and was set amongst rice paddies about half way to the Canngu Club, a brilliant country club which we could access as a Saba guest. The only downside to our stay was that we had to come home! Next time, we'll stay for two weeks. Thanks Saba, and we'll see you soon.
title: Brilliant luxury holiday, brilliant staff, can't wait to go back

text: We had the most relaxing time at Saba. Beautiful attentive staff who care for you and your every need. Almost next door to our favorite yoga centre and only 10 mins walk to evening sunsets on the beach. Perfect in every way . Thank you Bagus and all your beautiful staff . We will be back.John and Marg
title: Serenity, luxury, service

text:
We have stayed in 2 of the 5 villas-Yudhistira & Bima-in luxury, having fun, & food experiences with Balinese & western food by a chef & team, or the ability to self cater. All 5 villas open into one for anniversaries, weddings, birthdays, ie celebrations of friendship, with hidden sliding doors! The villas are large, elegant yet liveable, & we did not want to go outside! Staff extraordinarily helpful & successful in organising anything & so friendly & kind. Their gentleness was everywhere. Each villa has a pool, semi-outdoor bathrooms, with all amenities exquisite. Indoor outdoor living; wi-fi (not for me!); walking distance to beach (not crowded in Australian school holidays); and Canggu club, with memberhsip thrown in for our stay. All age-groups love SABA villas.
A must for 2-3 times a year - if they can fit us in!
title: beyond paradise! Amanda & Peter, Sydney

text:
This is the second time I have stayed @ Saba, & I can't tell you enough how AMAZING this Villa complex is. I have never been somewhere, where I was able to just 'switch off' & be so totally relaxed.

We have just returned from a friends 40th, where we had the whole complex with all our friends & our running joke now when things go wrong is 'this would never happen @ Saba.'

There are not enough words to describe the Staff @ Saba. Everyone there is so attentive, professional & always prepared to go above & beyond to ensure your stay is comfortable.

I have come back from Saba, trying to arrange a time to go back & to have more friends/family enjoy the experience as much as we did.
title: SABA ~ Put this one on your bucket list

text:
We stayed as a group of 18 at Saba to celebrate my 40th birthday. WOW! A stunning location flexible enough to allow a very private holiday or able to open up to allow a group to enjoy the beautiful gardens and pool areas together. Saba has a feeling of luxury with high end finishes and attention to detail. 
The staff are amoung the friendlest people I have met the world over, polite and so accomodating. We had asked to have a BBQ dinner together as a group for the last night and were treated to a banquet well beyond our expectations. A true oasis so close to Seminyak yet private and peaceful.
title: Perfect birthday celebration location

photos.caption: We sat by this pool for hours

text:
I honestly cannot remember a time where I have been more pampered or felt more welcome then at Saba Villas. The staff were so professional and friendly, not to mention the accommodation was simply out of this world. 

Saba is the most incredible experience. 5 minutes from Seminyak, but far enough away to have your own tropical paradise in a tranquil environment. If anyone is considering a place to stay in Bali, there is no other choice. The locals are friendly, the service is impeccable and the location is breathtaking. The Villa's themselves are modern and fully equipped to pamper.
title: Most luxurious vacation of my life

text:
I have stayed at Saba Villas five times over the last two years.... there is no other place I feel so relaxed, pampered, healthy, and happy.

The tropical gardens, with friendly gardener ketut, divinely comfy beds, unique art and furnishings, large private pools, gourmet fresh and healthy food, and only a short bike ride to echo beach or into the bustling nightlife in semniyak that is becoming at the same time increasingly familiar and ever evolving - this is my paradisical retreat away from home.

The staff really set this place apart. They are prepared to oblige every minor request- and are thoughtful and remember preferences and requests, bring in the morning paper, source vegemite and plan itineraries. They are friendly, cheerful and always happy to have a chat and tell me about balinese culture. For example, during two separate stays at Saba people I knew had motor bike accidents - on one occasion they were not even staying at Saba - and the attention and efforts of the staff was truly above and beyond what one would expect in ensuring that these people were able to get medical treatment and act as translators etc.

Attention to detail would be the overriding feature of the saba experience - I mean detail in the villas themselves, the food, and the service provided by the staff. I have never stayed anywhere like it, and can't recommend it highly enough!

Tera makasi Saba!
title: An oasis amongst the rice paddies...paradise

text:
I recently stayed at Saba and cant thank the staff enough. The villas are well layed out and enable privacy or interaction for larger groups such as ours. The staff were excellent and able to meet all requests including a function for 30 odd including food and staff.

The villa's were modern and well looked after and kept very clean. I cant recommend Saba highly enough for anything from a 1 bedroom, two bedroom or the larger 2 bedroom villas.

Thanks
title: Great Experience

text:
We stayed here as a group of 18 in July, and a much bigger group for a friend's 40th. The Villa and it's staff was a massive part of the reason we had such an amazing time. The villa itself is designed well, with a high degree of privacy, which is flexible enough to be opened up if desired. The villa would suit a couple, extended family or group of friends like we did. 
The staff are incredibly polite, respectful and accommodating- nothing was too much hassle for them, and the food was of high standard. 
The area is quiet at night, and the villa is set back off the "main" road in a rice field, so sleep comes easily. Will definitely return.
title: Amazing stay with fantastic staff.

text: Where to begin? The villas are drop-dead gorgeous, although that's something that could be said for many of Bali's accommodation options. What really gives SABA its cut above the rest is the attention to detail, and the incredible staff. They are friendly without being overbearing, and no request is too much- I needed a pair of crutches after a motorbike accident and Made (one of the heads of staff) spent an entire morning hunting some out for me, ended up travelling all the way to Denpasar and then refused a tip! It is clear that the staff genuinely love their jobs, and it makes all the difference. SABA's food is second to none (we felt like we were in a restaurant in our own lounge room!), and the semi-outdoor bathrooms are gorgeous. Comfy beds, a huge movie collection, access to the fantastic Canggu Club, beautiful pools, what else could you ask for? Visa extensions- SABA will help you! I have spent time in hotels across the world and SABA would have to be one of the standouts. Not to be missed.
title: Don't mess with the rest... SABA is the best!

text: Saba is absolutely beautiful. Each villa is private with your own pool, outdoor area, dining area, kitchen and bedrooms. Every area of the villa is immaculate, clean and designed for you to feel relaxed and at ease. The villas are surrounded by vibrant, green rice fields, bringing Bali to the door step of your villa. The staff are so kind and thoughtful, always happy to serve you and have a conversation with, and the food is delicious! Overall, Saba was breathtaking with sleek modern designs yet so serene and placid. To be very honest, I could have easily stayed in the villa and never leave to see the rest of Bali! Definitely recommended for anyone that wants a private, relaxing and enjoyable holiday with friends or family.
title: Beautiful villa and Fanastic service.

text: From the moment we were shown through our villa we were blown away.  We had booked the 2 bedroom villa but as that was already booked they upgrade us to "Bima"  -the 2 bedroom master villa.  The master villa is luxurious and private - and the outdoor bathrooms are beautifully done.  I just fell in love with all the rooms (plus paintings) and the outside pavilion overlooking the pool and lush garden is great place to relax.  The staff are friendly and very helpful.  The breakfast served each day is plentiful, with good selection of fruit, cooked breakfast, pancakes and cereal.  They have a menu for meals if you choose to eat in, all reasonably priced and good too.  My husband and I each had a massage which was arranged by staff and done by our pool.  Massages are good but had a pedicure which I would not do again as the polish came off very quickly (no OPI only cheap brands used).  We went to the Canggu Sport Club once, which is not far (you can walk to it) and that has lots of gym equipment plus pool but it was quite crowded, used mainly by ex pat's living nearby.  Our two girls were pleased to have full use of a laptop which Saba lend out with free internet connection (was actually able to skype family) and the DVD selection library is a nice extra.  Soaps, shampoos, conditioners and body lotions are supplied and are organic.  If you are looking for some luxury, privacy and peace these villas have it and we felt throughly spoilt after our 3 days there.
title: Luxury at its best, pure paradise

text: Saba Villas is the most amazing place I have ever stayed. It resonated quality and warmth. The villas were exceptional and the staff superb. Their smiles were contagious and they never faltered in the willingness and ability to assist. The meals prepared by the Chefs at Saba were world class. I particularly loved the decor in the villas and their attention to detail - very much following a strong Balinese theme. I just didn't want my holiday to end.
title: Nirvana

text:
We have just returned from a week at Saba Villas - travelling with our 3 teenage children.  We were with another 4 families and we hired out the entire resort.  What a wonderful week we have all had.
Saba is a relaxing tropical paradise set amongst the rice paddies.  The resort is beautiful. Very cleverly designed with great architectural features - the indoor/outdoor bathrooms are divine!!  The gardens are lush and well maintained, the pools sparking, the rooms are comfortable and stylish.

It is a short walk from Saba to the beach, where we often walked to enjoy a cocktail and watch the stunning sunsets over the ocean.
The staff at Saba are exceptional. They went out of their way to attend to our every need.  They arranged transport for shopping trips, organised white water rafting expeditions, elephant safaris, we had day trips to Ubud, boat trips to Lembongan Island to go snorkelling, surfing and moped riding.  We enjoyed cooking classes onsite with Saba's extremely talented Chef (Made) and his experienced and enthusiatic team.  Yoga classes were just a walk away down the road - and the nearby Canggu Club (with which Saba has an affiliation) - a charming old-wordly club - with a great gym, spa, pool, bars and restaurant.
There was lots to do - but we also took time out to relax and make the most of the beautiful  pools, gardens and ambiance. 
The shopping nearby in Seminyak was excellent. The restaurants and food that we experienced were also outstanding. Our children also found time to enjoy the Kuta nightlife.  
In short, a wonderful family holiday with something for everyone. We were only away a week, but it feels like it has been a lot longer. I have no hesitation in recommending Saba as a place to stay.  Enjoy!!
title: Relaxing Tropical Paradise set amongst the rice paddies

text: Saba villa has the most gorgeous & inviting pool.  The villa is spacious and beautifully decorated.  The staff are genuinely nice people, always ready to please & fulfill any requests.  We stayed there for 4 days & could not bare to get out of the villa the entire 4 days!  All plans, including a visit to canggu club & seminyak/jimbaran went out of the window as we were so contented in the villa that getting out was really hard to do.  Food is delicious, in house massages could be arranged in villa, all for a reasonable price.   Plenty of cable channels, dvds & books to keep anyone entertained.  We found ourselves very comfortable even when the whole troop of staff came in to clean up the space every morning.  They are friendly, warm & discreet.  It may not have all the amenities or comfort of a hotel resort, but it is a private villa resort with only 5 villas in total, hence the service is at par or better than most hotel.  The best part is the flexibility that is so often missing in big hotel/resort.  On our last day, we had a late flight & villa management graciously allowed us to stay in the villa until our departure time, even without us requesting!  That just sealed our holiday on a sweet sweet note!  Balinese hospitality at its best!
title: Home away from home

text: I've been to Saba a few times now and I can't get enough. The ambience, the service and the location creates the perfect concoction for a relaxing getaway in bali. Saba's villas are extremely comfortable and fun, with gorgeous pools and lovely decor . Pampering services come to you and there is a 24/7 butler service that caters to all your needs, which includes some of the best food, making Saba Villas very hard to leave! The staff are super friendly, reliable, trust worthy and very helpful. Saba is also near Seminyak, which has the best bars and restaurants in Bali. I highly recommend staying at these villas!! My friends and I love the place and will continue to keep going back!
title: Saba villas, a relaxing retreat

text:
Saba Villa is the most beautiful resort I've ever been to. 
I visited in December 2010 with my friends and would be delighted to go back. The rooms are amazing with an open wide concept design, the architect clearly put a lot of thought into the layout. To wake up every morning and be able to jump into a pool located right outside my bedroom was a dream come true. It was difficult to even leave the resort because it had everything you could wish for available. 
The food was incredible with a wide range of specialty dishes and you could order at anytime. Even better was the great prices of the food, especially since this resort is definitely a 5 star. 
The staff made the experience even more pleasant because they were extremely kind and helpful, as it was our first time to Bali. They set up day trips for us such as bike riding and white water rafting! 
I would recommend Saba to anyone who visits Bali because they won't be disappointed.
title: most amazing accommodation I've ever stayed in

text:
I spent a week at Saba with our group which included some sightseeing, a trip to Ubud, some walks to and along the beach, some sitting around the resort or swimming or reading or playing cards. OK there was a quite a lot of playing cards. There is a tranquility about Saba that makes everyday a pleasure no matter whether you decide to go out or not. There's plenty to do in Bali of course and we made sure that we gave ourselves enough opportunity to enjoy the island given our short stay.

Bathrooms at Saba are amazing and the pools are perfect. Staff were very helpful when we wanted to organise tours and are discreet and charming. Food was good.
title: Staying at Saba was like time in a different world

text: Aesthetically beautiful, peaceful and spacious, beautiful staff, exceptional personal service - Saba is a place that is hard to leave. This was our second trip and we couldn't wait to get back. Each villa is so completely private with it's own pool and immaculate gardens and the open air bathrooms are a work of art.  If you don't want to borrow one of their motor bikes or bicycles, it's a short taxi ride to all the shops and restaurants in Seminyak and a 10 minute stroll through ricefields to the Bali beaches. Fabulous - can't think of anything negative.
title: Close to Heaven at Saba

text: We spent 3 days 2 nights in SABA. This is our first holiday after having our first child. We did not bring old 8 mths old baby. Saba is an awesome place to rest and relax. The service is great, even though the iPod player and TV was not working so well when we first arrived, they were quick to fix it. The scenery around the Villa was great with Canggu Club nearby.
title: Saba Wonderful Saba

text:
Saba is an outstanding Villa set-up tucked away in upmarket Seminyak.  The Villa's can be connected so if it is a large group they can easily set up 2/3/4 interconnected Villa's to allow the group to socialise.  The whole place is absolutely immaculate and the staff are one phone call away before they come racing to the assistance of their guests.  The food is great and everything can be handled in house - taxi's, massages, etc.  They have good sound set up's so if you're after a private lie by the pool while you listen to your favourtie jams and drink cocktails, then this venue is for you.  As far as a destination - I could go to read, gather my thoughts and truly unwind and have never experienced anything as boutiquely perfect as SABA.  

5 Stars - unquestionably one of the finest Villa set ups on the Island.
title: SAB AHHHHH YEAH!

text:
Have spent 8 days at Saba, and it is difficult to do justice to have positive an experience it was.

The properties are as good as new and look just like the website images, The staff are extremely helpful and look after you from start to finish. The location is ideal, nice and quite but very handy for both Seminyak and the various beaches. You do need to take a taxi to get about but the villas were less than 30K Rupiah away from the centre of Seminyak.

Breakfast was excellent, and we had two light evening meals of high quality. Used the Canggu club for a big swim, Tennis and Gym.

I have no hesitation in stating this is an exceptional property.
title: You must stop here.

text: We didn't stay here long enough!  Although a tiny bit out from the main bustle of Seminyak, this is an ideal villa to unwind and chill.  We took friends and shared the two bedroom villa here at Saba with the offer of the Canggu facilities about 100 metres down the road.  Both bedrooms had large, outside, ensuite bathrooms with amazing shower heads the size of dinnerplates (one thing Bali is not short of is water!).  The main bedroom opened onto the garden, but the second one was a little bit darker and only opened to its ensuite.  Breakfast was vast with a great selection of local and international options, but the hot food did tend to take its time and end up being delivered a bit cold.  However, we could not bring ourselves to even partake of the Canggu Club because the pool and grounds of this villa were superbly maintained (wish I could bring that garden home!) and the staff were only too happy to order us a taxi (5 mins wait, max) to take us to 'Eat Street' or for shopping.  Have to mention the dodgy roads leading to and from the entrance to Saba - the word 'potholes' doesn't even cover the bumps etc, but it was small price to pay and the taxi drivers just giggled and went very slowly!  Would highly recommend this villa.
title: Lovely architecture, tranquil garden, beautiful pool, private and delightful.

text: OMG - You must stay in these villas even if for a few nights while in Bali - they are Heaven.  We stayed in the Master Villa Bima for 4 nights late October 09 and we were very sorry to leave and go to another villa in Seminyak (which did not compare)..  The villas are so clean and very well maintained.  The pool is huge (our 5yo and 3yo loved it) there was a huge amount of garden for the kids to run around.  The villa itself was a gorgeous piece of architecture.  The Breakfasts were plentiful with a wide choice.  Bagus and his staff were wonderful (and never infringed on our privacy)  The menu was great for ordering lunches and dinners.  You can order inhouse massages (which are better than the massages in Oz and only $15AUD per hour approx).  My sister and her partner were in BAli at the same time - they visited us in the villa at Saba and decided to stay with us a couple of nights they loved it so much - they are talking about staying there Oct 10.  We did not feel a need to leave the villa - we did go to the Canggu Club which was very handy .  Seminyak is about a 10minute taxi ride away ($2.90AUD approx).  After our stay here we would not return to the smaller villas in Seminyak - we would stay here for half of our stay next time and half in a resort (just for the kids club for the kids).  If you dont have children and you want to relax away from the hussle and bussle (I cant stand Kuta) this place is for you... A definate slice of heaven.. We will be back..
title: Saba Heaven

text:
On arrival you are greeted by the staff who present you with a fresh frangipani lei and a delicious fresh fruit cocktail. You are then escorted to your own private villa where the first sight to greet your eyes is your own private swimming pool surrounded by a lush tropical garden where a weed is not to be seen. The open air living area overlooks the pool.
On into the spacious bedrooms that again overlook the pool and a fesh frangipani flower rests on your pillow. Finally a bathroom which is to die for.  You have a choice of a terrazzo bathtub or a huge freestanding shower surrounded by your own private garden. 
Breakfast is a treat where you can choose from a range of menus. The fresh fruit plate comes with handcarved fruit on it and tastes as good as it looks.  After you have feasted on the sumptuous breakfast the staff will arrange any activities for you whether it is car hire you want or in room beauty and massage services. Nothing is too much trouble for the delightful staff.
The beach is a 5 minute walk away where there is also a bar from where you can watch the sun set over the ocean while enjoying a cool drink.
Chefs are on duty if you wish to have a meal from their menu  or you arrange for your own banquet or BBQ to be prepared in your villa.. 
You have your own private kitchen as well as a fridge stocked with a large range of beverages.
It is a place that you will want to return to regularly.
title: Absolute Paradise.....

text:
In Bali you have a choice of accomodation without limits (the bad, the good, the perfect and the exception, the same for the price). A new category is born since a few year: the private villa with the same service of the hotel. At the first sign, you don't consider this category....Don't do this mistake: the price is maybe really good and the service can be perfect,...you receive in"plus" the private luxury.
The saba villa is one of these perfect place. You stay at home somewhere far of your place. The feeling to be relax and good was expected, i receive more: the feeling to be at the right place. I was AT HOME far from mine. The Bima saba villa offer more than the luxury standart. The villa is more than large, the decoration is perfect, the private swimming pool is really a swimming pool. the garden is really a garden.
The staff is helpfull without limit. The food is great. You have a disposition bike,...You are in a good area to start the visit of the ricefields without to be too far of the vibrant (and noisy ) area of seminyak and other crowded place.
In summary the gem and a surprise even if it's the 4th time that i go in Bali
title: A GEM.......

text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 week stay at Saba Villas. Our 1 bedroom villa was awesome; it had everything we needed eg private pool, dining area to have any in-house meals, a lovely air conditioned bedroom that was clean & tidy & a lovely big indoor/outdoor bathroom/toilet. The Saba team were very cool, they answered every question we had, organised everything from in-house massages, scooter hire, in-house meals etc. We highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to be close to Canggu with walking distance to restaurants, cafes, supermarket, pharmacy & bank.. and a short scooter to the beach (wouldn’t suggest walking as the roads are crazy busy).
title: Highly recommended!

text: This was my 4th time staying at Saba Villa’s Bali. It has such a wonderful vibe and is close to so much from basic needs like bars, beach clubs, shops, groceries etc. The staff are so attentive. Our stay was as relaxing as can be and we’ll most certainly be coming back. Thanks to the Saba team for everything!
title: Bali’s Best

text:
This was our second stay at Saba Villas and we took our daughter, son in law and granddaughter with us. We stayed in Bima Villa one of the Master 2 bedroom villas
Our villa was spacious, luxurious with a great pool perfect for swimming or relaxing.
While the villa itself was amazing the staff were the main reason why we enjoyed our stay so much. Nothing was too much trouble.We were treated like family. Special mention to Made, the Manager, Mojito, Agus and Dwik.
A bonus is free access to Finn's Recreation Centre, Bounce and Water Splash which we made good use of.
Meals were delicious and singing Chef Made does a top job.
The free shuttle service to Canggu and Seminyak is great.
We can highly recommend the Massage Service provided by Saba Villas. Wayan and her staff are fantastic and very reasonable. We had a massage almost every day.
title: Sensational Saba

owner_response.text:
Wonderful review thank you Wayne.
Our staff truly genuinely enjoy serving our visitors. Your review gives them amazing feedback and encouragement, thank you.

We all look forward to your return one day
Andy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We’ve been travelling to Bali for many years and this was the first time we stayed in a villa.  Saba Villas certainly didn’t disappoint.  The villas are clean and spacious, the pool was lovely, staff are very attentive and the food excellent.  We’ll definitely be back to enjoy our new found ‘home away from home’ when in Bali.
title: Lovely villas and amazing service

owner_response.text:
Thank you very much for your comments. We strive for excellence and are pleased we did not disappoint you.
Look forward to your return soon.
Kind regards
Andy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: From the moment we arrived at Saba Villas we felt at home. The staff were so welcoming and friendly and nothing felt like too much trouble. We stayed in villa Nakula which was beautiful. The villa had a lovely pool and felt very spacious. It was great to have the villa manager or Mojito drive us to nearby places in town. Breakfast was great. Loved the smoothie bowls!! We ate dinner at the villa on one of our nights. The Indonesian food was good. The staff made you feel so special. Everything felt so seamless. We felt we had complete privacy and were able to call the staff if we needed anything and it would be dealt with straight away. We loved the nearby coffee shop called Nourish just across the road. The staff kindly gave us VIP passes to Finn’s beach Club on one of the days of our stay which allowed us free access with no minimum spend. If you are looking for a villa in canggu area then we would definitely recommend Villa Saba.
title: Wonderful staff, beautiful villa

owner_response.text:
Thank you most kindly Silpa for your beautiful review. We loved having you stay and hope you return soon ..maybe for a longer stay :)
Andy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
The villa is perfect for a Balinese break. The villa itself was clean and the beds were super comfortable. The staff went out of there way to help arrangements including massages, surfing and restaurant bookings.  

The villa is half way between Seminyak and Canggu so we got to experience both. We rented scooters so it was easy to get around. 

The added bonus was the VIP beds at Finns which was super fun.
title: Beautiful Balinese Experience

text: Once again excellent service.  Appreciate the airport pickup and driver available for drop offs to my son’s villa.  No problems organising a family dinner in the villa. Love the privacy and quietness of the villa and the staff are wonderful - friendly and helpful at all times. Ideal spot for a visiting nanna.  A big thank you to all the staff.
title: Perfect second time around

owner_response.text:
We are always here to make your visits seamless, enjoyable and safe. See you next time. Thank you kindly for your review.
Andy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Stayed here for three nights in Nakula suite in July 2022. Overall had an excellent time; the staff were extremely professional, the villas were clean and always attended to. Security was great, we needed to take a grab to most places (10-15 min from centre of canggu and Seminyak) but the complementary transport service from the villa came in very handy. Overall I would recommend this suite, and would come back again. Thanks to Made and the team for a pleasant stay
title: Highly recommend

owner_response.text:
Thank you Steve for your very kind review.  The staff relish the feedback they receive.
See you back here soon
Andy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
Rachel and I stayed at Villa Sadewa one of 4 villas in the Saba complex. The pool and open air bathrooms were a special delight. Access to Finns Beach and recreation club as part of the package was great, The gym at Finns is excellent and only 1000 meters from the Villa.
Thank you Made and team for making our stay so memorable. See you again n mid July ;) Sean & Rachel
title: Perfect

owner_response.text:
Delighted you enjoyed yourselves. We are all so happy to have been able to open up quickly and get back to serving our guests. Our staff love our visitors.
Andy
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We stayed at the nakula, 2 bedroom villa by Saba. The villa is really spacious, has a very cozy and beautiful set up. Rooms are very clean and beds are very comfortable as well. Both bedrooms has an outdoor bathroom that can be a bit hot during the day but it is always a delight to experience an open space shower:)

As we want to explore the many popular restaurants in canggu that are very close by our villa, we didn’t have a chance to try the in house meals but we were prepared fresh juices, tea and coffees in the morning. 

Service is excellent in saba and we are really thankful for the hospitality of the staffs, great attitude, friendly and very professional, thanks to pak made, dewik, august, aman and the rest of the crew.

Repainting walls in the bathrooms and main entrance would be great but we do understand that bali has just open up and it will take a while for things to catch up.

Overall we really enjoy our stay and would recommend to our friends!
title: Great and spacious place for family to stay!!

text:
We have stayed at many villas in Bali and rate Saba Villas as our favourite.
It is rare indeed that you can say that your experience is FAULTLESS from beginning to end. We were made to feel most welcome right from the moment the ever smiling Mojito picked us up to our farewell. The staff are a treasure with excellent English. In particular, we want to thank Mojito, Aman, Made the Manager and Dewik for making us feel part of the Saba family.
Saba has only 5 villas, four of which are 2 bedroom, and our one bedroom Villa named Arjuna. Our Villa was clean, spacious and well appointed.
The pool was amazing. A good size, crystal clear and the perfect temperature. We have never spent so much time in a pool and kept on thinking that it was the perfect place to relax and just the right warmth.
Breakfast had a good variety and was excellent. When in Bali we usually go out for meals as there are so many wonderful restaurants. However, we decided to eat almost every meal and a good proportion of the dishes on the menu, at Saba Villas because the food was delicious. Chef Eddie and Chef Singing Made made eating at Saba Villas a pleasure. Plus the food is very reasonably priced.
Saba Villas is situated on a typical Canggu Street, narrow and busy so walking isn’t really an option but the staff will happily transport you anywhere in Canggu. Plus there is a bakery and supermarket next door.
Saba Villas has free access to Finns Recreation Centre and Finns Beach Club ( see separate reviews).
We would highly recommend having at least one massage, if not 2 or more, whilst at Saba Villas. Saba doesn’t have its own spa but our masseurs, Wayan (female) and Annie were outstanding. A cheap price for a quality one hour massage.
title: Simply Superb Saba

text: We stayed in Nakula at Saba villas for 5 nights in January. The welcome we received on arrival made us all happy. Fresh frangipani lei, cool drink and cold towel. The gardens are exceptional, the pool was large and beautiful. I felt immediately relaxed and calm. And the bathrooms were a highlight, partly outdoors and so large, with the toilet around the corner and out of the way. Also, having a separate toilet off the kitchen made it easier when you were hanging out by the pool or lounging on the sofa all day. All of the staff were beautiful and made the villa clean and comfortable. We enjoyed going to Finns and it helped that we could get a lift wherever we wanted to go, nothing was too much trouble. The only thing we didn't like was that we were not close to Canggu proper and the roads are very narrow and very busy that we could not walk anywhere, which was why getting the lift was very helpful. Our family of 4, 2 children aged 10 and 14 would have liked to have a closer proximity to the bustle of Canggu and to Batu Bolong beach. But having said that, the kids were definitely grateful that they did NOT have to do too much walking!

Stayed in the Sadewa villa for 5 nights with some extras included in a package deal.The villa  is nice and large with 2 bedrooms and bathrooms. It was very clean on arrival and was kept that way for our entire stay . The pool was fantastic both temperature and size wise. 
Everything was excellent but the most impressive aspect for us was the way the staff handled our request for gluten-free food for our son. We notified them in advance but in past experience at other accommodation places throughout the world you get the yes yes not a problem but on arrival it's a  disaster, but not here. They really understand what was required and offered a  great selection which our son said tasted great. This was the case for all the  food we ate, it has really good flavours. Perhaps the serve sizing could have been a bit bigger but we were just so happy our son had something to eat! 
The free passes to the Finns clubs was a  great addition as was the free transport to both facilities.  There is a really good supermarket 100m from the entrance to the villas as well as a  money exchange.  The only  negative which is  NOT a reflection on  Saba Villas itself is the really narrow streets with no footpaths. We like to explore the  areas by going for walks or runs but this was just impossible as the roads were crazy busy all the time.

text:
We went to Bali on a mums holiday in Sept 2019.  This was my 6th trip to Bali.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for 5 nights.  The villa is beautiful and has an open living space and fully equip kitchen. There are two bedrooms, one with a queen bed, the other with 2 singles.  Both bathrooms are fully open to the courtyard gardens.  The villa was lovely and clean.

Beautiful pool which was always a great temperature and we spent lots of time sitting in the pool side cabana.

The Finns rec club membership was awesome, and it was great having the free shuttle to the gym and back every morning.  On our last day we had to check out at 12pm, but we stuck around at Finns and used the gym/shower/spa and pool facilities to fill in the afternoon until our airport pick up at 5.30pm. 

The free shuttle would also take to any spots in Canggu and Seminyak which was great.  (You have to make your own way back).  However note the footpaths are non-existent and often you have to walk on the road!  Taxi is safer option.  Blue Bird taxi’s don’t seem to operate in Canggu, so you are best to negotiate local driver.

The staff were friendly and accommodating.

The breakfast menu maybe needs a little fine tuning or some variety each day if possible?  Though we sometimes just wrote on the menu what we would like rather than ticking boxes etc.  The food was yummy though, smoothie bowls were the highlight.  We did order room service one night and it was good and quite affordable.  We had 2 dinners included in our luxury escapes deal, but we struggled to find nights to fit it in! 

Once suggestion would be to have a TV in the main living area.  There are TV’s in both bedrooms though.

So many yummy restaurants nearby, you have to try Cabina, Lola’s Shakin all day, Bali Bowls and Smoothies & Lupe.  Only difficulty in Canggu is the lack of footpaths.  But there some beautiful boutique shops.  There is a handy chemist and mini supermarket about 50ms away from the Villa.

We spent the day at Finns Beach club – the handy Finns membership gave us around 15% off our total food & drinks bill which saved us around $50 – Great!

Overall I would recommend.  The membership to Finns was the best perk, I’d love to come back with the kids so they could enjoy the splash park.
title: Mums trip to Canggu

Yes Blue Bird taxis are the most reliable taxi to use in Bali and they do operate in the Canggu area. Our staff only use Blue Bird Taxi if our own shuttle is already being used.

text:
My family and friends, consisting of 18 adults and 6 children, spent an absolutely blissful week at Saba Villas. We booked each of the 5 villas in the Saba complex which was perfect for our large group. The interconnecting walls of the villas can slide back so that we could easily roam from villa to villa which was a feature that the kids loved. 

For our second night the Saba team and I arranged a dinner / party for 29 adults and 9 kids. What a night! We had a wonderful banquet dinner, decorations, a 3 piece band and fireworks. It was such a highlight of our trip and organised with very little fuss. 

Another great feature at Saba is the food. You can order room service off a large menu which is a feature you don’t always find at villas. Singing Chef Made also held a Balinese cooking class that included a trip to the local market to buy food which our group couldn’t stop raving about.

We also found the Saba Villa shuttle bus was so handy. It dropped us off and picked us up from different destinations which saved us catching taxis.

Mainly the part we loved the most was the warm hospitality shown to us by the Saba staff. In no time at all, they remembered all of our names and treated us more like friends than villa guests. Nothing was ever too much trouble for the villa manager Made and his team. It really made our holiday.

All in all, I couldn’t recommend Saba Villlas enough. We can’t wait to go back.

text:
My husband and I stayed at Saba for 5 days. We would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a lovely place to relax and unwind. Food, service, villa, pool all 10/10. For those who want a bit more detail please see points below. 

Thanks guys, especially Andy for helping us rearrange when I messed up our dates, you're a legend! We'll definitely be back.  

* Villa: We stayed in the 1 bedroom Villa Arjuna. Clean, lovely indoor-outdoor living area. Big rain shower looking onto the garden. Gardens beautifully maintained. 10m pool with deep end, good for swimming. The 2 bedroom villas have much larger pools. Fast wifi (2 of us were able to game without any issues), good air conditioner. Tap water is from a well & actually drinkable but ample bottled water (in recyclable bottles - love how environmentally friendly they are) provided. Nice and quiet. Comfortable bed and lots of pillows to choose from. Full kitchen you you want to cook for yourself. We did not haha. 

* Service: 10/10. Every evening they put out mosquito coils so mosquitos aren't an issue at all. Transport to Seminyak provided or surrounding areas (beach, shopping area). Villa provides free access to the Finns recreation centre (gym, pool, water parks etc) and Finns beach club. Had an in-room massage everyday which the villa organised at my request, cost ~$15AUD. Great massage! 

* Food: Delicious breakfast brought to your villa, included in the price. Balinese and Western options. Lunch/dinner menu with lots of variety, reasonably priced (cheap compared to Australian prices but expensive compared to local Balinese restaurants). Mini bar same as above. There's also a supermarket next door if you want to save a few dollars. Special thanks to the team for leaving the kitchen open pending our arrival. We got in about 11pm and they had stayed around so we could order food - much appreciated!

* Location: Short drive to Seminyak, Echo beach or main area of Canggu but not close enough to walk comfortably (although villa does provide transport). Within easy walking distance are several restaurants, supermarket, pharmacy and a few shops.

* Price. 5-star quality accom and service but for a very good price. We come to Bali a lot and this place is good value without compromising on quality at all.
title: Perfect place to relax and unwind
